comments:
When double-clicking the database schema at "Data Source Explorer", I got an error and could not retrieve any database object such as table.with Sun JDK. (It seems DB connection is successful.)
 
 Build date: dtp-SDK_0.7RC1_N032106
 OS: RHEL4 U2 WS ja_JP.UTF8
 SW: DB2 UDB ESE V8.1 FP 11
     Sun JDK 1.5.0_06-b05
 Steps to recreate problem:
        1- Open Data Source Explorer view
        2- Launch New Connection Profile wizard
        3- Select SQL Model-JDBC Connection as profile type
        4- Specify a name at New JDBC Connection profile panel and Click Next 
        5- Select the "IBM DB2 Universal for DB2 UDB V8.2"
        6- Click "Test connection" and ping is successfull.
        7- Click "Finish" 
        8- Right-click on the connection profile and select "Connect"
        9- Expand the connected DB and go to a schemas (ex. DB2ISNT1)
       10- Try to expand the schema to get a database object
       And then, I got an error at consolelog and could not get any database objects. 


-- error at consolelot ----- -----------------------------

Hello,

Could you please try running Eclipse from the command line with the -debug option?  It appears there is a problem loading the DB definition, but the error is only logged to stdout.  You should be able to see this error in the shell window.

Thanks in advance,
Rob
Generally improve error reporting, logging and tracing.
With -debug option, I did not get any logs at all.

Can you verify whether or not you have WTP installed? I think this may be a duplicate of https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=137746.

Thanks in advance,
Rob

you're right. WTP was installed. 
Without WTP, this problem did not occur and I got Database objects correctly with SUN JDK.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 137746 ***
